main_definition: Sand is a naturally occurring granular material composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles, often found in deserts, beaches, riverbeds, and seashores.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Idiom: A problem or situation that seems to have no solution
meanings_and_examples.example: After hours of trying, he realized the sandbox was too full; it seemed like a lost cause.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Metaphor: Small issues that add up over time and become insurmountable problems
meanings_and_examples.example: When we ignored small arguments at work, they were just little grains of sand that eventually piled up into an unmanageable mess.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Metaphor: A trivial or easily forgettable thing in comparison to something more significant
meanings_and_examples.example: In the grand scheme of things, her broken phone screen was just a grain of sand.
